Cri. M.C No. 6266 of 2013 Dated this the 01* day of January, 2014. ORDER Petitioners are the accused Nos. 1 and 3 in O.R. No. 9/98 of Nelliampathy Forest Range. The offences alleged are punishable under Sections 27(1)(e)(iii) and (iv) of Kerala Forest Act. The Crl.M.C is filed seeking to quash charge sheet and all further proceedings in C.C No. 852/2005 now pending as LPR No. 1/2010 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Alathur. 2. There are 8 accused in the crime. All accused except accused Nos. 1, 3 & 8 faced trial and they were acquitted by the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Alathur. Annexure-B is the copy of the judgment dated 08/12/2005 in C.C No. 695/01. 3. The accused No. 5 confessed in P3 statement that four persons along with him had committed the offence of tress-pass and felling of trees along with accused Nos. 2 and 3. After referring to Annexure-P2 mahazar and P3 confession statement, the learned Magistrate found that the discrepancies in the extract of confession contained in P3 and P4 confession given by A5 are not explained by PW2. It was pe ee 2014/KER/59 Cri. M.C No. 6266 of 2013 ; also observed that there are no independent attestors to the statement purportedly recorded by PW2. The learned Magistrate concluded that P3 statement cannot be relied upon without corroboration from other sources and that the discrepancies discussed above appearing in P3 and P4 remains unexplained. In the circumstances, the court found that complainant has not succeeded in proving the offences against the accused. The learned Magistrate found that accused Nos.A2, A4 to A7 are not guilty of having committed the offence. 4. The case against the remaining accused was split up and refiled as C.C No. 852/05 and is now pending as LPR No. 01/2010. It is submitted that in the light of the acquittal of the co-accused there is no scope for proceeding against the remaining accused since the prosecution has mainly relied upon the confession statement of the fifth accused and that the court below has disbelieved the confession made by the fifth accused. Since the other accused were acquitted, for the very same set of reasons, this Court is of the view that no purpose would be served by continuing the prosecution against the petitioner. 2014/KER/59 Crl. M.C No. 6266 of 2013 3 Accordingly, Crl.M.C is disposed of quashing Annexure-A charge sheet and all further proceedings in C.C No. 852/2005 now pending as LPR No. 1/2010 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Alathur. HARUN-UL-RASHID, JUDGE. Isn
